newsitem.title: JAPAN: M'bishi, NTT Data guarantee debts of pinball firm.
newsitem.headline: M'bishi, NTT Data guarantee debts of pinball firm.

text.p: Mitsubishi Corp said on Tuesday that it and NTT Data Communications System Corp had guaranteed a total of 40 billion yen of debts of pinball card company Nippon Leisure Card-System Co.

A Mitsubishi spokesman also said the firm, which makes prepaid cards for "pachinko" pinball gaming machines, is 18.85 percent owned by Mitsubishi. It had cumulative debts of 46 billion yen as of the end of September, up 20 billion yen from six months earlier.

Mitsubishi Corp announced its earnings for the half year to September earlier on Tuesday. It posted 5.61 trillion yen in sales, down 12.3 percent from a year earlier, and 35.7 billion yen in parent current profit, up 22.5 percent, in the period, the first half of the 1996/97 business year.
Nippon Leisure Card-System lost 18 billion yen due to forgery of its pre-paid pinball cards in the period from April to September, the Mitsubishi spokesman said.
The company lost 55 billion yen for the same reason in the full business year which ended on March 31, he added.
